fields.description: Given an existing label e.g. "Documentation", be able to rename it e.g. "Docs" and have that change apply to all existing uses of that label.
fields.summary: Rename label and apply changes to all existing uses

fields.description:
To plot out a development roadmap, it's not just groups of tickets that need to be visible - sometimes, it's just a single ticket.

With the current setup, a wrapper Epic with a single child ticket must be created in order for that item to be visible on the roadmap.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Next Gen Roadmap to include standard (non-Epic) issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Agile Wallboard gadget is not loading board content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard or use an existing one.
# Add the Agile Wallboard Gadget and select a board.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should load and show all the issues presented on the board.

h3. Actual Results

The gadget does not load any data.

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-14 at 9.01.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The browser console shows the following error:

{code}Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 ()
batch.js:10388 Uncaught TypeError: $ is not a function
    at Object.GH.WorkView.showLoadingPool (batch.js:10388)
    at n.GH.WorkController.loadPoolData (batch.js:10360)
    at n.GH.WorkController.initializeWorkMode (batch.js:10360)
    at Object.r (batch.js:10360)
    at j (batch.js:38)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (batch.js:39)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js:41)
    at j (batch.js:38)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js:39)
    at Object.fire (batch.js:39)
2/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest:1 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 (){code}

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard gadget is not loading board content

fields.description: As a user/admin, I would like to add issue collectors to Next-Gen projects just like classic projects.
fields.summary: Issue collectors in Team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Description
Selecting a to date only on Cumulative flow diagram on Next-Gen causes it to change the date to year 1969

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a next-gen project
# Enable Reports
# Open the Cumulative flow diagram
# Select date filter *All time* and fill the *To Date* to any date only, leave the *From* empty
# After selecting the To Date, it refreshes the page and select this date: 1969/12/31

 !Screen Recording 2019-08-14 at 03.01 PM.gif! 

h3. Expected behavior
Cumulative flow diagram should allow selecting a To Date without a From date and keep that selection

h3. Actual results
After selecting the To Date, it refreshes the page and auto-fill this date: 1969/12/31

h3. Workaround
Select a From Date first and then select the To Date to avoid this from happening.
fields.summary: Selecting a to date only on Cumulative flow diagram on Next-Gen causes it to change the date to year 1969

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If browser language is set to Spanish, an issue cannot be transitioned if there is a rule to set a custom field of date type during the transition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next Gen Project.
 # Create a custom field of Date type.
# Create a rule to fill out the custom field when issue is transitioned to *In Progress*.
# Change browser language to *Spanish*.
# Create an issue in this project and try to transition it to *In Progress*.

h3. Expected Results
Issue should get transitioned successfully.
h3. Actual Results
Cannot transition and the below error is thrown.
 !Screenshot 2019-08-14 at 7.13.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 
(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
Change browser language to English.
fields.summary: Unable to transition next gen issue when browser language is Spanish

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is possible to search for "deploymentEnvironmentType" in the Issue Navigator (using advanced search). However, there is no column option to add "deploymentEnvironmentType" search result.
h3. Suggested Solution
provide "Deployment Environment Type" column in the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Add a column for "Deployment Environment Type" in the Issue Navigator.

fields.description:
- JSWCLOUD-17150 resolves a similar issue of not being able to add existing issues to Epics
- However, the current workflow for new issues is an efficiency pain point: Create Issue Screen >> Navigate to Issue >> Add to Parent/Epic Dropdown (this workflow must be repeated for every new issue)
- An ideal workflow would be to have an "Epic Field" inside the Create Issue Screen
- This is especially useful if the "Create Another" checkbox is ticked
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to add issues to epics in Next-Gen (Agility) projects from the issue creation view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue types on Next-gen projects can't be updated.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud (Next-gen projects)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Next-gen project
 # Go to project settings
 # Issue types
 # Select an issue type
 # Update a field
 # Try saving

h3. Expected Results
The issue type is updated

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Sorry, something went wrong and we couldn't update your "XXXXX" issue type
{noformat}

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Try removing dropdown/people field from the screen.
fields.summary: Errors while editing Next-gen issue types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to issue on a next gen board
 # Assign the issue to a sprint
 # Refresh board

h3. Expected Results

Issue is seen in the sprint and has the correct sprint in the sprint field
h3. Actual Results

Issue is in the backlog and sprint field is empty, even though the sprint history shown the sprint being assigned.
h3. Notes

This is due to invalid data in the DB. Cause is likely to be a bug which has already been patched. Another fix is required for this.
h3. Workaround

Recreate the issue
fields.summary: Adding a sprint to a next gen issue is not persistent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Burnup chart doesn't consider estimation changes when the Story points estimation is set to 0 or none.

h3. Environment

Classic project in Jira Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic Scrum project
# Add issues to the project
# Add story estimation to some issues
# Create a sprint and add the issues with estimation set to this sprint
# Start the sprint
# Change the estimation of one of the issues in the sprint to "0" or "None"

h3. Expected Results

The Burnup chart red line decreases and the estimation change is registered in the table below the chart

h3. Actual Results

The Burnup ignores the change in the issue's estimation

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-12 at 5.39.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-12 at 5.40.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Burnup chart doesn't consider estimation changes when the Story points estimation is set to 0 or none

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When integrating Jira with Crucible, some information is missing from the development panel section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an application link between Jira and Crucible
# Create a review in Crucible and reference a Jira issue
# Open the issue in Jira and view the development panel (It should reference the Review just as expected
# Click the *Review* to view information related to it

h3. Expected Results
Information is displayed

h3. Actual Results
No information is displayed (Blank page is presented)

The below exception is thrown in browser console:
{noformat}
batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1704 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'reviewDate' of undefined
    at Backbone.Class: JIRA.DevStatus.DetailDialogReviewView.JIRA.Templates.DevStatus.DetailDialog.review [as template] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1704)
    at Backbone.Class: JIRA.DevStatus.DetailDialogReviewView.renderSuccess (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1742)
    at Backbone.Class: JIRA.DevStatus.DetailDialogReviewView._handleFetchSucceeded (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1721)
    at x (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1393)
    at Backbone.Class: JIRA.DevStatus.BaseDetailDialogModel.trigger (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1391)
    at Backbone.Class: JIRA.DevStatus.BaseDetailDialogModel._fireSuccessResult (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1724)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:1724)
    at j (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:38)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:39)
    at d (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jiraSpaIframeApi=true&locale=en-US:164)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Crucible information not being displayed on Development Panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to connect Jira cloud to a Bitbucket account from the *DVCS Accounts* page, a *500 error* is being thrown

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Jira with a Bitbucket account
# Delete the integration
# Try connecting Jira to the same account once again

h3. Expected Results
Integration is created as expected

h3. Actual Results
5xx Error is returned 
*  !Screen Shot 2019-08-12 at 11.32.19 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
To have the existing workaround applied, please submit a support request through [this link|https://support.atlassian.com/contact], referencing this bug.
fields.summary: 5xx Errors returned when connecting Jira to Bitbucket Account

fields.description:
Need to include field for user created date in export so that users can be managed more effectively. If a user has 'never logged in' as last login date. We can't discern if the account was just created, or created 6 months ago. We need this info to meet a security policy of 'deactive account if user has not logged in for 6 months'.   

Also, components field below does not have 'admin' which is what this is. So forced to select random component. What is ADV??
fields.summary: Jira User Export (server) needs 'User Created Date'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to rank/add issues to sprint on Next-gen projects if the issue type was added after the project's creation.

h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen project
 # Add a new issue type
 # Create issues with Story type
 # Create issues with the new issue type
 # Create a sprint
 # Add the Story issues to the sprint, and it will work
 # Try adding the issues using the new type to the sprint
 # Refresh the board page and issues added on step 7 won't be in the sprint

h3. Expected Results

All issues are added to the sprint or ranked
h3. Actual Results

Issues using the new issue type won't be ranked/added to sprints
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround

Go to the board's _Features_ page and toggle the _Sprint_ feature
fields.summary: Unable to rank and add issues to sprint on Next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Mandatory fields are not checked when splitting an issue from the scrum/kanban backlog of a Classic project.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try splitting an issue from the scrum/kanban backlog of a Classic project.
 # The issue will be split even though the mandatory fields are not filled

h3. Expected Results

While splitting the issue, the error should throw stating mandatory field not satisfied.
h3. Actual Results

Issues get split without respecting the mandatory fields.
h3. Workaround

No Workaround
fields.summary: Mandatory fields are not checked when splitting an issue

fields.description:
Hi, I have got a problem with story points, there are not visible on the board and issue card. 

!image-2019-08-08-09-29-25-391.png|width=568,height=160!

Story points are marked as visible in issue configuration 

!image-2019-08-08-09-30-22-313.png|width=525,height=407!

And Biard settings was changed to Story Points estimation. 

!image-2019-08-08-09-31-07-556.png|width=758,height=259!

Why I am not able to see Story Points? Please help.
fields.summary: Story points not visible

fields.description: As a product owner, I would like to allow users that submit a request to up-vote existing requests, so that I can gain an understanding of what are the most popular feature requests.
fields.summary: Allow Next Gen tickets to be voted on

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When any special character is added in the backlog search. The URL retains the special character and does not refresh when it is removed or changes
h3. Environment

 * Jira cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Go to any backlog section of Jira software project
 # Type the following:
 ## !screenshot-1.png|width=205,height=51!
 # Special character removed:
 ## !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 # The URL search result retains the character despite changing or removing the special character as shown below:
 ## 
{code:java}
 secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=16&view=planning.nodetail&search=ca%5B{code}

h3. Expected Results
 * Dynamically change when the character is removed or changed

h3. Actual Results
 * The URL search result retains the character despite changing or removing the special character

h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: URL search result retains the special character from backlog search.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects have only one subtask issue type, while company-managed (formerly classic) projects allow the creation of multiple subtasks types.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the possibility of creation of multiple subtasks issue types in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project
fields.summary: As a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project admin, I want to be able to add different subtasks issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user has next-gen projects, they will see statuses from those in the following pages:
 * Gadgets that use the Statuses in the configuration - "Time in Status" and "Filter Counts", for example
 * "Sub-Task Blocking Condition"

h3. Steps to Reproduce

For *Sub-Task Blocking Condition*:
 # Create a next-gen project
 # Edit a transition of a *Workflow* for a classic project
 # Click on *Conditions*
 # Click on *Add condition*
 # Click on *Sub-Task Blocking Condition*
 # Observe multiple of the same status (e.g., *DONE*)

For Gadgets
 # Go to *System dashboard*
 # Click on *Add gadget*
 # Add *Average Time in Status*, for example
 # Observe repeated statuses in *Statuses* section

h3. Expected Results

Only show one instance of the status.
h3. Actual Results

Shows 1 + (the number of next-gen projects there are). For example, if an instance has 5 next-gen projects, it shows *DONE* 6 times.
h3. Workaround
# Change the name of the status on the *Statuses* page
# Perform the desired change
# Change the name of the status back to it's original value on the *Statues* page
fields.summary: Next-gen project statuses appearing on "Time in status" gadget or "Sub-task blocking condition" causes confusion

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching and voting on this ticket.

Parent links are now visible in the top left corner of the Issue Details view. You are also able to view child issues in the view. Example screenshots: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

When you are moving an epic to another project and the epic has child issues, you would get a prompt asking if you would like to move the child issues along with the epic. Likewise, if you are moving an issue and it has a parent issue, then you will get a warning to tell you that the issue will lose its parent link. Example screenshots: 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!

We are closing this ticket as resolved. If you feel this issue hasn’t been fully addressed, kindly tell us more about your use case.

Thank you,

Emily Chan

Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}
Suggestion:

Parent Link, Epic Name and Parent link fields should be populated in the Issue Details view for issues in next-gen projects.

 

Currently it's possible to create Epics and issues, then to create child issues, but those relationships are not shown in the Issue Details View.  But revisiting the issue, one can see that the child issue is attached to its parent
fields.summary: Allow nextgen project issues to link to parent or epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format* (date picker) is changed in the *Advanced Settings* of Jira, you won't be able to start a Sprint and when you click on the *Start sprint* button, it goes into an endless loop.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Advanced Settings* and change the *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format* to something like "dd/MMM/yy h:mm a".
# Go to a SCRUM Board and *Start sprint*

h3. Expected Results
A window pops up for Sprint duration then confirm to start the Sprint.

h3. Actual Results
A spinning wheel comes up and loops infinitely.

 !2019-08-07_16-38-53.gif|width=400&height=200!
 
h3. Notes

It seems that the spinning icon looks different per browser but the behaviour remains the same.
You can start the Sprint using the mobile app on IOS or Android.

h3. Workaround
Remove the value being used for the *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format* by clicking on *Revert*.

Or, apply a valid one.

The table below shows some examples of date format, and how both values should match:
||Preferred Date/Time||Value of the jira.date.time.picker.java.format property||Value of the jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format property||Comments||
|2020-08-12 08:21|yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm|%Y-%m-%d %H:%M|[ISO 8601 format|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601]|
|12/Aug/20 8:21 AM|dd/MMM/yy h:mm a|%d/%b/%y %l:%M %p| |
|08/12/20 08:21 AM|MM/dd/yy hh:mm a|%m/%d/%y %I:%M %p| |
fields.summary: Sprint can't start if date picker is changed to an invalid value in Advanced Settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It will be easier to use drag and drop features  like panels when migrating next gen project to classic. It should also be smart enough to warn end user for signs/pre-requisites not met for projects moving back to classic.
h3. Environment

NA
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to a next gen project
 # Allow the potential to drop this project into a classic project via drag and drop
 # If issues like below are hit  , a warning to users should be provided:
 ## IN PROGRESS state it will not show up in the destination.
 ## If this is COMPLETED it will not show in destination project.

h3. Expected Results

A seamless method to drag and drop a next gen project into a classic project
h3. Actual Results

There are multiple clicks and checks needed to complete a next gen to classic project migration. Including clean up tasks after migration.
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Migrating Jira Next Gen Project to Classic needs to introduce drag and drop feature

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Navigate to project create.
 # For classic Kanban, select *What's in this*.
 # Navigate to the second screen of the carousel.

On the second screen of the carousel, copy should read:
{quote}Add work and prioritize as needed, so your team always picks the most important item from the top of the to-do list.
{quote}
Actual behaviour: missing "the" before "top"
fields.summary: Fix typo for Kanban project description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Burndown Chart is not summing up the subtasks estimation when using Original Time Estimate set on the board.

h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic Scrum project
# Access the estimation configuration on the board and set it to *Original Time Estimate*
# Create some stories and add subtasks to them
# Add time estimation to the stories and subtasks
# Create a sprint, add the stories created to the sprint and start it
# See the Burndown chart

h3. Expected Results

According to the [Burndown chart documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/burndown-chart-777002653.html], the expected behavior is:

||Subtask behavior when _remaining estimate and time spent_ is enabled||Subtask behavior when remaining estimate and time spent is disabled||
|If you add a subtask to an issue that's already in an active sprint, the subtask is treated as scope change. The scope change is also indicated in the Burndown Chart.|If you add a subtask to an issue that's already in an active sprint, the subtask is also treated as scope change. However, scope change is not indicated in the Burndown Chart for the subtask.|
|Time estimates of subtasks are rolled up to the parent task. This means that the parent task will have the total sum of all remaining estimates of the subtasks.|Time estimates are tracked individually across the subtasks and the parent task itself.|

h3. Actual Results

The actual results are:

* If you select the option "Original Time Estimate" as a parameter in the Burndown chart report, the subtasks are not displayed and their estimation _is not_ summed up to their parent issue, independently if the option "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" is enabled or not
*  When the "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" is enabled, the Burndown chart shows another parameter, "Remaining Time Estimate". If you use this parameter in the report the subtasks are displayed individually in the report.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Burndown Chart is not summing up and "burning" the subtasks estimation when using Original Time Estimate set on the board

fields.description: Renaming the issue field from "issue" to "item" makes more sense because not everything being created is an "issue" but everything whether an epic, story, bug, etc is an "item".
fields.summary: Change Name of Issue Field

fields.description: In *About Jira*, outdated and incorrect version data is shown. Attached screenshot of the complete details shown in about Jira.
fields.summary: About Jira shows incorrect Jira versions/data.

fields.description:
I'd like to track how long it takes members of my team to complete a task once they have been assigned to said task. However, as the assignee field is not currently a time field as far as I can tell I don't have a way to track from that change. This leads to imprecise measures and little recourse. 

Adding a time stamp to the assigned field, and potentially creating a better gadget for measuring average time between point 1 and point 2 would both be very helpful.
fields.summary: I'd like the ability to create filters that can measure time from assigned change.

fields.description:
As a developer, I would like to be able to associate any BitBucket branch with one or more Jira tickets.  I cannot do this at this time because the branch name must include the ticket's key.

It would be great if I could associate any branch, regardless of the branch's name with any Jira ticket(s).
fields.summary: Allow linking a BitBucket branch with a Jira ticket without having to include the ticket key in the branch name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Despite being a core system default field in the product for Jira Software, the *Story Points* field is not locked and can be duplicated.

This not only could cause confusion around this field but causes disruption in core agile features such as Reports, Portfolio, Estimates, ect... 
 
h3. Notes
What makes this custom field a Story point field is the applicable Issue Type context.

h3. Propose solution
Lock the *Story Points* field so that it can't be modified by admins.
fields.summary: Story Points field is unlocked and can be duplicated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When loading due date field on cards in next-gen boards, the date is displayed in Jira instance timezone instead of user's timezone setup in the browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add due date to an issue type
 # From a next-gen board, click on Project settings menu item
 # Click on Issue types
 # Add Due date field under Context fields section for an given issue type
 # Click Save changes
 # Go back to board

Change Jira's instance timezone a timezone different from the browser
 # Go to Jira settings
 # Go to System
 # Change timezone (Americas/Sao Paulo) to a different timezone setup in the browser

Seeing wrong due date
 # From a next-gen board, open any issue and set a due date via issue view
 # Close issue view dialog
 # The due date display on the card is different from the one display in Bento

h3. Expected Results

The due date set in issue view should be the same displayed on the card when user's timezone is different from Jira instance one.
h3. Actual Results

The due date displayed on the card is different from the date set via issue view when Jira's instance timezone is different from the browser's timezone.
h3. Workaround

The work around at the moment is to have both Jira's instance and browsers timezone the same.
fields.summary: Due date loads date in Jira instance timezone and not the one set up on the browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Despite being a core system default field in the product for Jira Software, the *Story Points* field is not locked and can be duplicated.

This not only could cause confusion around this field but causes disruption in core agile features such as Reports, Portfolio, Estimates, ect... 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new *Number Field* and name it "Story Points" (though it doesn't really matter what name you use).
# On this field, configure the field context for applicable issue types to the *Story* and *Epic* Issue Types only.

 !Custom_fields_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The field is expected to behave as a user-created number custom field.

h3. Actual Results
Jira sees this as an actual Story point field and treats it accordingly, pulling data from each one.

One example is converting a Task to Story as shown below:

 !Move_Issue__KFF-3_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
What makes this custom field a Story point field is the applicable Issue Type context.

h3. Workaround
Remove the applicable Issue Type context to stop it from behaving like a Story point.
fields.summary: System Story Points field is unlocked and can be duplicated

fields.description:
As a PM, I want the ability to quickly pull up the % complete of an epic via JQL so that I can populate many of my reports/dashboards automatically, without the need to calculate this one value manually.  

 

Ideally % complete would be the number of (incomplete issues / total number of groomed issues)
fields.summary: Make % epic percent completion available for reporting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The only way to see and transition Sub-tasks directly on a Next-Gen board is to group by Subtask.  To work on a subtask from other group by views you must look at the story directly and drill down the hierarchy to see the child sub-tasks.  If you apply a Group By Sub-Task option to a next-gen board then apply a filter for a specific Epic to see the sub-tasks of the stories in a specific epic, no issues are displayed.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud Next-Gen Boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an epic,  on a next-gen board
# Create 2 stories with sub-tasks on each
#* For comparison Only link one of the two stories to the parent Epic the second should be independent (No Parent Epic)
# Set Group By to Subtask
#* NOTE: this will display Both of the Stories as swim-lanes with the Sub-tasks under the parent story, and only one of the two Story issues is linked to the epic as parent
# Set Filter to the epic that is the parent of the story above

h3. Expected Results
The story and sub-tasks of that story will be displayed where the story is linked to the Parent Epic 

h3. Actual Results
No issues are displayed
 
h3. Notes
!Screen Shot 2019-08-02 at 9.05.28 AM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-08-02 at 9.39.51 AM.png|thumbnail!

To display the desired behavior in a Classic board This action is the equivalent of setting a classic board to Swimlane = Story and then adding a Quick filter to display *"Epic Link" = <Epic Issue Key> OR issuetype in (subTaskIssueTypes())*

h3.Workaround
Set the group by filter to None or Epic to be able to see issues in an epic then select the stories to see the subtasks of that story one by one
fields.summary: Conflict between Group by and filter options

fields.description:
We would need to show 4 custom fields on kanban card. JIRA Agile now only allows 3. We have a few important calculated custom fields and we can't show them anywhere on the kanban board as the details view does not allow calculated fields to be shown and we have already used the 3 slots on the kanban card.

Actually, we would prefer showing some of the calculated fields on the details view, so if https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10191 gets implemented then this is not so critical.
fields.summary: More than 3 custom fields on kanban card

fields.description:
Hello, I have tried the new generation projects and I like the blackboard and the roadmap, but for a large company that wants to standardize the new generation projects they are not an option, it would be possible to implement the roadmap view and the kanban board in a classic project?

 

Hola buenas he probado los proyectos de nueva generación y me gusta la pizarra y la hoja de ruta, pero para una empresa grande que quiere estandarizar los proyectos de nueva generación no son una opción, seria posible implementar la vista de roadmap y la pizarra kanban en un proyecto clásico?
fields.summary: Roadmap in classic projects

fields.description:
Currently, there is no functionality to customise the column configs for the issues inside the release view. Only the present configs i.e (Priority, Type, Key, Summary, Assignee and Status) are available in the release view.

Functionality should be given to the users to customise the columns according to user needs
fields.summary: Customise columns in Release view

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When you group a Kanban board by subtask there are 2 problems:
 # The constraints don't work properly. If you have a parent issue in the constrained column and its child issue in another column, the parent issue is not counted in the constrained column
 # You cannot visually see where the parent issue is on the board, you only see the child issue(s)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create next-gen kanban project
 # Create 3 issues
 # Create a subtask for issue 1
 # Create a column constraint for In Progress column Max:2
 # Move all three issues into In Progress - the max is breached and column highlights
 # Select Group by Subtask - still see highlighted column
 # Move issue 1 subtask to Done (don't change status of issue 1)
 # Now the column is not highlighted but it should be because issue 1 is still In Progress 

h3. Expected Results

Since parent task is still In Progress, the constraint should still be breached. Also should visually see parent task in it's column
h3. Actual Results

The constraint is not breached even though the parent issue is still In Progress and should cause it to be breached.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Grouping a Kanban board by subtasks results in column constraints not working correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, next-gen projects don't have the option to right-click on a card to see the available options like in classic projects. You have to click on the "..." button to see them.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable right-click option on cards for next-gen projects on top of the existent "..." option.
fields.summary: Enable right-click option on cards for next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to select more than one card at the same time using the shift key and clicking on more than one in next-gen projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow multi-selection of cards in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Allow multi-select option of cards in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
After creating a new column in next-gen board and then immediately creating new issues under the newly created column, makes the new issues to disappear from the new column and display under the first one (refer to attachment)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load board
# Create new column
# Inline create some cards in the NEW column (you have to create an issue in the first column in order to unlock inline create for other columns)
# watch as they get moved to todo column after 1-2 seconds

h3. Expected Results
The newly created issues should remain under the newly created column.

h3. Actual Results
The newly created issues "jumps" back to the first column.

h3. Notes
After creating the new column and a data fresh happens or page is refreshed the new cards remain in the correct position.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page or wait for 3min until the board is updated by polling.
fields.summary: Issues created under newly created column jump back to the first column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding story points with decimal places sometimes causes the story points overview to have incorrect sum with too many decimal places.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a next gen board with estimation enabled
 # Create issues in the same sprint or backlog with story points: 1.25, 1.707, 3.289, 23.234

Please see attached screenshot
h3. Expected Results

Story points sum should be 29.48
h3. Actual Results

Instead it is 29.480000000000004

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding story points with decimal places sometimes causes the story points overview on next gen boards to have an incorrect sum

fields.description:
Hi, 

Some users have problems with Jira in the moment of report new issue when they create a issue a white screen show them and they can't see the backlog.
fields.summary: I have some issues with my users and with JIRA Software

fields.description: When an issue popup opens, I want to see the ticket ID in the tab title. It currently shows me "FOS board - Agile board - Org name". Instead show me FOS-152 or whatever, so I don't have to go back and forth trying to find the issue number I am working on.
fields.summary: Change document title when popup is open

fields.description: Within a Project, the list of People against that project shows all users even if their site access has been revoked.  It would be useful to see on this page those users who are actually no longer on JIRA
fields.summary: Project People List should indicate users that no longer have site access

fields.description:
As a admin, I want to be able modify the worklow in the next gen projects to stop users from logging time on closed issues. 

Jira Next gen has a public roadmap available at https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/jira-software , but it does not address this use-case.
fields.summary: Allow admins to stop users from logging time on closed tickets in Next gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Based on the documentation [Burndown chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/burndown-chart-777002653.html], "The Burndown Chart is based on your board's column mapping. An issue is considered to be 'To Do' when it is in a status that has been mapped to the left-most column of your board. Similarly, an issue is considered to be 'Done' when it is in a status that has been mapped to the right-most column of your board."
That means that it should consider on the report only those issues whose status is mapped in any of the active columns. In the other hand, issues which status is not mapped should not be considered as we don't know if it should be worked or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum board and add issues
# Edit the status mapping columns and remove one of the statuses
# Create a sprint
# Add issues to the sprint
# Make sure that at least one of the issues is in the status that is not mapped
# Estimate the issues
# Start the sprint
# Check the Burndown report

h3. Expected Results
Only issues whose statuses are mapped should be considered at the report according to the documentation.

h3. Actual Results
It is considering all the issues that are inside of the current active sprint, disregarding if the status is mapped or not
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Burndown chart is considering into the report issues on unmapped statuses

fields.description:
h3. summary
When Issues are dragged between columns, available statuses should be displayed:
{quote}If the target column is associated with more than one status then, when the issue hovers over that column, each status will appear as a separate section with a dashed outline{quote}

However, it's the transition names that are displayed; for transitions that weren't included in the original Simplified Workflow.

h3. steps to reproduce
# create a Project and a board for it;
# associate more than one status to one of the columns;
# attempt to drag an Issue into the column containing more than one status - the transition name will be displayed instead of the Status name.

*Additional notes:*
- this doesn't affect default transitions in the Simplified Workflow

h3. Workaround
Go to the project settings > workflows and edit the transition name to match the status name
fields.summary: Transition names displayed instead of available statuses when dragging issues between columns

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a next-gen Kanban project using Chrome or Safari
# In Japanese [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method], type "kyouto" and select "京都" from the suggested list

h3. Expected Results
"京都" gets confirmed and the focus stays there waiting for further input. Video: https://youtu.be/R27Rl13x1Lw

h3. Actual Results
"京都" gets confirmed and the next card gets focused. Video: https://youtu.be/jCS180-SerY
 
h3. Notes
* This happens in macOS 10.14.6 using Chrome or Safari

h3. Workaround
* Try using Firefox
* Move the issues to a Classic Kanban board using the steps described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html]
fields.summary: When pressing Enter key to confirm the character using IME in a next gen kanban board/backlog, focus moves to the next card instead of remaining there
Need ability to transition issue via edit issue end point

fields.description:
Next-gen projects have its own access type as the following:
* Open
* Limited
* Private

It would be great if users could search for projects by access type in JQL, or retrieve the project access type by an API endpoint.
fields.summary: Add a JQL or API endpoint to search next-gen projects by access type

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of February 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. Being able to share/copy the configuration of a next-gen project boards is something that will be available, although it is not something that we will be focusing on in the next 12 months. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

In the short term we recommend teams use classic projects when you need to share configuration. We apologise for the inconvenience this may cause you. 

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams find value in sharing configuration. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
Eoin Ryan
Product Manager
{panel}


h3.Summary

In Classic projects, user can use their setting using the "Create with Shared Configuration" function. However, currently this is not available for next-gen projects.
It would be great if next-gen projects have the ability to clone them.
fields.summary: Ability to clone team-managed projects

fields.description: please
fields.summary: test2

fields.description: please ignore
fields.summary: test

fields.description: I'm sure this is already an open issue but I couldn't find it. My team often "cancels" issues  for various reasons and we were able to do this with the old project type. Currently, next-gen only supports "done" which is not descriptive enough for issues we really cancel. It means we have to choose the lesser of two evils... either confuse our stakeholders (they see "done" but the work was never actually completed) or we lose the history (when we delete the issue).
fields.summary: Next-gen project backlog - support multiple "Resolved" columns

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all, 
Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this ticket.
We understand that Next Gen is currently lacking in powerful filtering capabilities, especially when it comes to custom fields or the ability to save filters to be quickly and frequently viewed later. 
As this ticket is a duplicate of JSWCLOUD-17274, we are closing this ticket so that we can aggregate the feedback on a single ticket. 
Cheers,
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}
 

We are maintaining a single Next-gen project for 3 different "products" each owned by different individuals in our organization. The People custom field was a really nice addition, but it's not very helpful if we can't filter the backlog using it. Currently, it appears you can only filter by "Epic", "Label" and "Type" but allowing filtering of 1 or 2 custom fields of our choice (or even only the People field) would be very much appreciated!
fields.summary: Next-gen project backlog - filter by custom fields

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I would like the ability to transition an issue when it's added to a sprint from the backlog.

For example, transition an issue from "Backlog" (in the backlog) to "Selected for development" once it's added to the sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like that when an issue is added to a sprint, it's automatically transitioned to another status

fields.description: Enable sharing of created Tempo Logged Time Reports with other users. Create a unique url for each report and enable sharing. This shall save a whole lot of hassle when it comes to preparing and presenting reports.
fields.summary: Enable sharing created tempo reports with other users

fields.description:
With classic project boards, downloading a CSV file gives an indication of the epic that stories are associated with. (Custom field (Epic Link)).

This allows for bespoke reports when aligning stories for various reasons (such as budgeting).

 

With Next Gen CSV downloads, the 'Epic Link' column is not populated, meaning it is not possible to find a 'Parent' Isuse', nor are there any other ways to sort-by-epic when managing CSV downloads unless an export is done for each epic.
fields.summary: Show the Parent epic of a (child) issue when exporting a CSV file (or populate the 'Epic Link' column)

fields.description:
Hi

I need the title of any given Task, Story and Epic when using Issues and Filters in Next Generation projects.

Only using the ID Number of each Task, etc is not sufficient, as it is impossible to remember all the Numbers, but you can always remember the name of any given Task etc.

Br

Heidi Maul Jars
fields.summary: Next Generation projects showing the title of Tasks, Stories and Epics in Issues and Filters

fields.description: When using Issues and Filters I need the title of the Task, Story or Epic in order to easily
fields.summary: howing the title of the Story, Task or Epic and not just the number when using Issues and Filters

fields.description:
Hi

I've been using Next Generation projects, but I need the name of the Epic shown on each Task or Story under Issues and Filters. Right now it is such a hassel to open each task to investigate how much time was spent on each Task or Story. I need to be able to filter this. Not as: I have this Epic with these Tasks or Stories. But as: I have these Tasks and Stories all belonging to a certain Epic. this way I will be able to see the hours spent in 1 minut, without opening any Tasks and Stories.

In general the reporting in Next Generation projects is quite poor..

I will be more than happy to provide screendumps, but it seems I'm unable to attach them.

If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Br

Heidi Maul Jars
fields.summary: Next Generation project Epics added to tasks and stories under Issues and Filters

fields.description:
Hi,

Resolution is currently a sticky business. The moment i modify a auto generated workflow, it becomes an immutable field from UI and has to be set/cleared using a Post-Function(even in old Issue view). Would be great to have it as a field in the new issue view UI and let the user set the appropriate status from there.
fields.summary: Add ability in new issue view to set resolution

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing parent of a subtask is not updating the sprint value of the subtask. If the parent of a subtask is changed from an issue in an active sprint to an issue in backlog or future sprint, the active sprint does not get completed and throws "something went wrong" error.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a sprint
 # Add a subtask to one of the issues in the current sprint
 # Use the "Move" option for the subtask to move the issue under another issue in the backlog or future sprint.
 # Change the status of all the issues in the current sprint to "Done"
 # Try to complete the sprint.

h3. Expected Results

The sprint gets completed.
h3. Actual Results

The UI throws the error "Something's gone wrong" error

The below error is thrown in the console.
{noformat}
bundle.esm.js:60 Uncaught (in promise) Error: GraphQL error: Exception while fetching data (/completeSprint) : org.springframework.web.reactive.function.client.WebClientResponseException: HTTP 400 Bad Request. Error when calling https://atlassian-proxy.eu-west-1.prod.atl-paas.net/cloudid/e3bf75d6-dfd6-434a-9df8-29aba4f71789/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/600/complete: {"errorMessages":["Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on following issues: OYEF-31"],"errors":{}}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Temporarily move the subtask to a parent issue type and then finalise the sprint. Also, please use the "Change parent" option in the meanwhile to move the subtask as then this bug will not occur.

OR

A [bulk operation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-902498099.html] can be executed to the affected Sub-Tasks in this state and update the *Sprint* field to its respective Sprint based on the parent.
fields.summary: Cannot complete sprint in next-gen project if a subtask is moved from an issue of active sprint to backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, next-gen boards can't show sub-task issue types in the same manner it can other issue types, like bug, tasks, etc.   It makes it very difficult to understand the body of work that might exist within the board and the statuses of each sub-task.  While next-gen now has the "Group By" function which can show sub-tasks, it only can show those sub-tasks when grouping the entire board in that manner.   That is not desirable in all situations because you then can't group by other things like assignee or Epic.   

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if next-gen boards would allow you to view sub-tasks like it can any other issue type.


h3. Why this is important
It would help to give end users better visibility into the all the issue types, not just standard issue types. 


h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Ability to view subtasks on the Board in team-managed projects (without using grouping)

fields.description:
Many times the priority of the reporter/customer doesn't align with the priority of the project team. It would be nice to create one or more custom field that use the same "jira priority options and icons" but allows for multiple priorities to be set. 

Another option would be to extend priority in service desk projects to have an "Internal" priority (not visible to customer) and "public" priority (Customer/Reporter)
fields.summary: Project Priority and "Reporter" priority

fields.description:
h3. Description
When using a Kanban or Scrum board in a next-gen project, grouping issues by subtask don't display their status or ID number. This is a feature present only in classic projects.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a next-gen project (Kanban or Scrum board);
# Create stories or task with sub-tasks;
# On the board, group issues by sub-tasks;

h3. Results
* Actual
This is how it's at the moment:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-23 at 08.41.10.png|thumbnail! 

* Expected
This it's how it should be in the future:
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-23 at 08.45.19.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there's no workaround.
fields.summary: When using the group by subtasks in a next-gen board, stories with subtasks no longer show their column status nor ID #

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unresolved epics are missing on _add parent _dropdown

h3. Environment
Next-gen projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a next-gen issue
 # Click on ... button
# Add parent
# Search for an epic

h3. Expected Results
All unresolved epics are listed on _add parent _dropdown

h3. Actual Results
A few open epics are not listed on _add parent _dropdown

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Epics on open status are missing on Add Parent dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a Smart Commit in Jira, after at least a day is passed after the commit is done, Jira Development Panel will display a difference in the time between the information that is displayed in Bitbucket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Perform a Smart Commit in a Jira Issue;
# Wait at least 24 hours or get an older Smart Commit;
# Mouse over the Commit information in Bitbucket and Jira.

h3. Expected Results

The displayed time should be the same.

h3. Actual Results

There is a difference in time as it seems Jira is not considering the timezone and applying GMT+0.

h3. Notes

Bitbucket:
!Image 2019-07-22 at 10.51.28 AM.png|thumbnail! 
Jira:
!Image 2019-07-22 at 10.52.31 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Commits in Development panel display a different time between Jira and Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Active sprint board, when issues are moved between columns, the column names (TO DO, IN PROGRESS) overlaps the issue content.

h3. Environment
Jira cloud - Windows OS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Jira on a windows machine and navigate to a software project with an active sprint.
# Move an issue from one column to another.
# Board refreshes and column names overlap the issues.

h3. Expected Results
Column names should show on the top when issues are moved between columns/statuses and should not overlap issue content.

h3. Actual Results
Column names overlap issues.

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the browser, hard refresh (F5) shows the columns at the top and doesn't overlap the issues.
fields.summary: In Windows OS, board columns overlap the issue content when issues are moved between columns

fields.description:
As a person who estimates issues in Agile Poker for Jira I want to see "completed issues estimated for X" mached by label. 

We label tasks in our backlog as [automation], [UI], [backend] etc. and it would be great if algorythm which gets tasks for comparison took label into consideration. This could be an option in session configuration.
fields.summary: Agile poker - better completed issues estimated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking "project settings" in a next-gen project from a plugin item (e.g., com.kanoah.test-manager) doesn't work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install com.kanoah.test-manager plugin
 # Go to a next-gen project
 # Click "project settings" (it works)
 # Click "Tests" (plugin)
 # Click "project settings" (again)

h3. Expected Results

Navigates to project settings, as it does in step 3
h3. Actual Results

Fails to load and no errors in the console.

 
h3. Workaround

Click on any other navigation item from the plugin view, then click "project settings"
fields.summary: Can't navigate to project settings from plugin on next-gen project.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Boards don't load properly if they have no status mapped to any column
* Error 500 in the console

h3. Environment
* Jira Software boards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the board backlog or active sprints view

h3. Expected Results
* The board should load correctly

h3. Actual Results
* The board won't load and will not render correctly
 !rendering-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The following errors may appear in the console

{code}
GET https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json?rapidViewId=1&selectedProjectKey=ABC&_=1522954471500 500 ()
{code}

{code}
{errorMessages: ["This board has no columns with a mapped status."], errors: {}}
errorMessages
:
["This board has no columns with a mapped status."]
errors
:
{}
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Go to Board settings > Columns and reconfigure the columns and status mapping configuration.
fields.summary: Boards not loading and not rendering correctly - Error 500

fields.description:
Bulk editing issues to change the sprint results in losing historical context.
 * Have issues in a sprint (Sprint 1).

 * Close that sprint.

 * The issues now have two sprints (Sprint 1 and Sprint 2).

 * Bulk edit or just edit issues to move them to Sprint 3 - it loses the history having been part of Sprint 1.

There is then no means of editing the sprint to add it back.

 

This will only reproduce itself when you move the issue to a new sprint. If you move the issue back to its previous sprint, the history will be maintained
fields.summary: Bulk editing issues to change the sprint results in losing historical context

fields.description:
Steps:
 # Begin composing an issue, such as a bug
 # Add a numbered list to the description
 # In one of the numbered list items, nest another numbered list
 ## (like this)
 # Preview the issue and note the nested numbered list's style
 # Publish the issue, then note the nested numbered list's style again

Expected: The styles match in steps 4 and 5, e.g. if if the preview showed *numbers* next to each nested numbered list item, numbers are what show once the issue is published.

Observed: The styles don't match. I saw numbers in the preview, but letters (a., b., c.) in the published issue.

Please let me know if you need more info!
fields.summary: Nested numbered list style in issue composer's preview doesn't match published style

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Burnup report displays "issue removed from sprint" when  issue  was not part of the sprint. 
h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sprint
 # Create an Epic
# Create a few issues and add the Epic created above as their parent
# Start the Sprint
# Open the Burnup report

h3. Expected Results
Issues that were never added to the sprint shouldn't be listed.
Or, the Epic's children could be displayed without the label "issue removed from sprint"

h3. Actual Results
Issues that were not added to the sprint are listed on report.

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Burnup report displays "issue removed from sprint" when  issue  was not part of the sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a sub-task Issuetype, the Sprint field is not visible on the new issue view and doesn't contain the Sprint value inherited from the parent task
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Next-gen Project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen Project
 # Create a sub-task Issuetype
 # Add the Sprint field to the sub-task issuetype field
 # Add the Parent task to the current Sprint

h3. Expected Results
 * The sub-task Issuetype should show the Sprint field when viewed inherited from the parent task.

h3. Actual Results
 * The sub-task Issuetype, doesn't display the field on the new issue view. Going to the old issue view https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true the Sprint field is visible but with an EMPTY value which is not inherited from the parent task

!Sprint-1.png|thumbnail! !Sprint.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint field on the next-gen project doesn't display on the new issue view for sub-task Issuetype

fields.description:
When viewing an issue on a next-gen board in Chrome, a drop shadow appears as a separator between the issue content and the rest of the board for contrast.

This shadow is not present in Firefox or Safari, providing little contrast/an inconsistent experience. 

!D_QIuCeU4AIxUDH.jpg!
fields.summary: Shadow separator between next-gen issue and rest of board

fields.description:
# using 'next gen' project on cloud service
 # When I click 'complete' the sprint'. it says 'Something's gone wrong, refers the page and try again.'
 # everything is listed as done.
 # When I look at the chrome js console, it says
bundle.esm.js:60 Uncaught (in promise) Error: GraphQL error: Exception while fetching data (/completeSprint) : 
org.springframework.web.reactive.function.client.WebClientResponseException: HTTP 400 Bad Request. 
Error when calling https://atlassian-proxy.us-east-1.prod.atl-paas.net/cloudid/9963da2e-ef66-4efa-816b-092aa48a2eb8/jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/90/complete: 
{"errorMessages":["Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on following issues: V8-158, V8-159"],"errors":{}}
 # V8-158 and V8-159 isn't in the sprint I'm trying to complete. However, I manually moved these sub-tasks from the sprint to a task in the backlog
 # When I look at the sub tasks in 158/159, they are listed under the original parent's sprint and not the new parent's backlog.
fields.summary: moving sub-tasks in 'next-gen' doesn't move them to the backlog/sprint

fields.description:
In a previous company that used Jira Server, we used to use placeholder users like 'Dev' 'QA' 'Product' to indicate that it's waiting for anyone from the relevant team to pick it up, rather than 'unassigned'. This was useful to stop everyone wasting time opening/looking at tickets then realising it wasn't for them to action.

In a smaller Jira Cloud company with per-user charging, doing this adds a fair cost to the product for something that, while useful, isn't essential and disincentivises doing this.

My suggestion is to have a cheaper/free 'fake' user that doesn't have a login that tickets can be assigned to, or to have the ability to assign tickets to a role/group and for that 'role/group' to appear in the board views (with avatar etc). It should also be possible to auto-assign tickets to these users if possible, as you can with normal users. Users can then reassign to themselves when they start working on an item.

The phrasing of 'what is a user' in the FAQ _any user that can login to Jira Software and exists in User Management._ made me think this may be possible already, as I want a user in User Management but without a login, but I couldn't see a way of doing this_._
fields.summary: Addition of assignees without logon to improve 'unassigned'

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

Setting 'jira.issue.actions.order' to 'desc' not working on New JIRA Issue View
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable *New Jira issue view for software projects* in Profile Settings
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *desc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted oldest > newest, i.e ascending order
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *asc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted oldest > newest, i.e ascending order.


 # Disable *New Jira issue view for software projects* in Profile Settings
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *desc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted newest > oldest, i.e descending order
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *asc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted oldest > newest, i.e ascending order

h3. Expected Results

When setting *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *desc,* comments on tickets should be sorted newest > oldest, i.e descending order
h3. Actual Results

Comments order remains in ascending order (oldest > newest)

 
h3. Workaround

Disable New Issue View
fields.summary: Setting 'jira.issue.actions.order' to 'desc' not working on New JIRA Issue View

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want the issue's children to be displayed on their order creation (top-down).

Currently, the children issues are displayed in their order creation from down to the top, and this may create confusion, and considering the children issues cannot be reordered (feature request JSWCLOUD-17284), it would be better if the issues were displayed on their order creation, from top to down.

 !Screen Shot 2019-07-15 at 8.58.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the issue's children to be displayed on their order creation (top-down)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Significant performance problems when updating the issue description of an issue on a next-gen backlog

h3. Environment
Next-Gen projects only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use latest version of Chrome
Go to the backlog of a next-gen project
Open the details view (Bento) for an issue
Try to update the description

h3. Expected Results
I can edit the description and the UI remains responsive

h3. Actual Results
Massive lag while typing in the description, see attached video.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Significant performance problems when updating the issue description of an issue on a next-gen backlog

fields.description:
Would be nice to have a setting / toggle that hides all images shown on cards when viewing a Jira Software board since they can take up a lot of space.

You can Show/Hide attachments only card by card by hovering over a specific attachment in next-gen projects, but this option is not available in classic projects.
fields.summary: Ability to hide all images when viewing a board

fields.description: we would really appreciate if you could set up SLA for Jira software for stories,bugs,epics...
fields.summary: SLA for JIRA Software

fields.description:
When selecting multiple backlog items in Next Gen projects using "SHIFT+Click highlights all text below or above the selected items on the browser.

The backlog multi select should be improved so the browser doesn't automatically select all displayed text.  

This is extremely annoying when trying to re-arrange multiple backlog items at once.

!image-2019-07-16-14-29-23-004.png|width=1142,height=332!
fields.summary: When using Shift+select to select multiple backlog items, dont highlight text on non selected items

fields.description:
In the backlog view of a Next Gen project when multiple backlog items have been selected I should be allowed to assign all selected items to a user.

 

!image-2019-07-16-14-21-16-460.png!
fields.summary: Add the ability to change assignee when multiple backlog items are selected.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Next-Gen project boards reach over 5000 issues, the board loads empty.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen project;
 # Create 5001 issues.

h3. Expected Results
 * Display all the issues in that project on the board.

h3. Actual Results
 * The board loads without any Jira issues displayed upon it.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Next-Gen board does not load issues when there are over 5000 issues

fields.description:
h3. If we try to search attachment through JQL, it does not work with new issue view and if we run same JQL after disabling the new issue view it works fine
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step1: Upload any-file in attachment
 Step2: Search that file through JQL, It does not give any response
h3. Expected Results

The JQL should run successfully and return the attachment with its filename
h3. Actual Results

Does not return any output

 

 
h3. Workaround
Disable new issue view and it gives expected output.
fields.summary: Attachment search through JQL does not work if the new issue view is enable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a Sprint backlog contains an issue that is in a non-editable status, moving the issue to a Sprint will display a misleading error message "_This issue cannot be edited because of its workflow status_"
h3. Suggested Solution

The error message should display something similar like "the issue can't be moved to the selected Sprint because it is in non-editable status."
h3. Workaround 

set Workflow properties: "jira.issue.editable: true"
fields.summary: Misleading error message when moving an issue in a non-editable status

fields.description:
I want to be able to use Quick Links gadget with some custom links as well. That can't be done at the moment, as there's only some pre-defined links that can be used, which are of no interest.

Also, I want to have a Summary Gadget which would upon clicking a Gadget from within the summary to direct me to the whole gadget (auto scroll to it).

Thanks,
Erik
fields.summary: Custom Quick Links and Summary on Dashboard

fields.description:
It is good to have manual test steps through filters in jira cloud after installing XRay

https://confluence.xpand-it.com/pages/releaseview.action?pageId=21760052#ImportingandExportingTests(CSV)-Exportingtoaprintablelayout/PDF
fields.summary: Need feature for “Manual Test Steps (Export)” custom field for Xray in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
In TestFlight 2.3 and iOS 13, testers can send feedback directly from the beta app 
by taking a screenshot and sharing detailed feedback with a crash report immediately 
after a crash occurs.

Can you consider creating a JIRA web hook and interface so that we may use JIRA/App Store Connect interface to log such issues and directly pull them from App Store Connect into JIRA via an API call?
fields.summary: Webhook  to submit bugs from App Store Connect to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Issues in this epic* field behaves differently on the old and new Jira issue view based on your application access to Jira Software.

h4. Old issue view:

If you don't have application access to *Jira Software* but have access to *Jira Service Desk*, you are able to view an Epic but the *Issues in this epic* field will be hidden, thus not being able to see the Issues under the Epic here.

 !_SCRUM-382__Nomad_-_JIRA_old.png|thumbnail! 

h3. New issue view:

If you don't have application access to *Jira Software* but have access to *Jira Service Desk*, you are able to view an Epic and the *Issues in this epic* field is clearly visible and you are able to see the Issues under the Epic here.

 !_SCRUM-382__Nomad_-_JIRA_new_view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behaviour

We expect this field to be consistent with each view. Either they do not appear on both the old and new issue view or they *do* appear on both views when you do not have *Jira Software* application access.
 
h3. Workaround

Give application access to *Jira Software* if you explicitly need to use the old issue view, otherwise, you can use the new issue view to view the *Issues in this epic* field.
fields.summary: Cannot view Issues under an Epic in the old issue view

fields.description: We have lots of different teams working on a design next gen board. Would be great to be able to filter by reporter or have quick filters that can be assigned to different jqueries so that we can have better views of our work.
fields.summary: Add support for filter by reporter

fields.description:
Would be great to have support for URI links on text paragraphs that are added to new issue types. 

 

Reason: we want to add selectable zeplin links to these paragraphs but right now they just show up as plain text.
fields.summary: Add URI link support on next gen projects

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to be able to select custom fields of type Date Picker in the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget, X and Y-axis.
fields.summary: Searchable date picker custom field

fields.description:
# JSWCLOUD-17064

it has over 100 likes but it's workflow is wrong so I don't believe you ever saw it
fields.summary: Already a request but you guys haven't even acknowledged it per your outline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing a Classic Software Project with no board associated that was accessed previously and left when the release page was the last one that was accessed lands on the release page that return all releases (archived, unreleased and released)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic software project
# Delete the board associated to the project
# Access the release page
# Create some releases and archive some, release others and left some unreleased
# Leave the filter to display everything
# Close the browse page and open it again from a new tab
# The project will land at the releases page showing all the releases

h3. Expected Results
The page should load only with the unreleased features, no matter what was the options that were checked.

h3. Actual Results
In a project that you have a large list of releases, leaving the page without selecting a filter from the releases, will always return the page with all features.

h3. Workaround
Before leaving the page, check the Unreleased releases from the quick filter and leave/close the page. When accessing it again, the releases that will be displayed will be the unreleased one.
Use the quick filter with the check marks always to filter the releases that you want to display.
fields.summary: Accessing a Classic Software Project with no board associated lands on the release page that return all releases (archived, unreleased and released)
